actions.text: Reported to Senate from the Committee on the Judiciary, S. Rept. 93-128.

actions.committee: Senate Committee on Rules and Administration
actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on Rules and Administration.
Reported to Senate from the Committee on the Judiciary, S. Rept. 93-128 (Part II).
Reported to Senate from the Committee on Rules and Administration with amendment, S. Rept. 93-146.

official_title: A resolution authorizing supplemental expenditures by the Committee on the Judiciary for an inquiry and investigation relating to the representation of citizen interests.

summary.text: (LATEST SUMMARY) Increases to $4,067,600 (now $3,946,800) the amount authorized for the Senate Committee on the Judiciary to investigate and study all matters set forth in S.Res.56, 93rd Congress. Provides that not to exceed $120,800 shall be available for a study or investigation of the representation of citizen interests, of which amount not to exceed $2,000 may be expended for the procurement of individual consultants or organizations thereof.

titles.title: A resolution authorizing supplemental expenditures by the Committee on the Judiciary for an inquiry and investigation relating to the representation of citizen interests.
